A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Not what I was expecting. Got tickets to Wednesday  for me and a few friends. No one liked the movie\, the cramped plot\, the butchering of what makes Star Wars magic.

The movie starts with you realizing that the antagonists of the series have been reduced to a joke. Not "marvel" joke but a real one. Why is that?
Character progression is next to nonexistent with one glaring exception: Luke. He was twisted and turned until he became something you don't expect. You don't believe. 

Forced subplots that serve no purpose but to take screen time. Buildups that lead to nothing Nonsensical romantic plot\, two characters that spend TFA together just drift apart.

This movie is a mess and made a mess of the Star Wars name. 
Mr. Lucas\, I forgive you for the prequels. 
And Mark\, we're with you.
